intro: Psychotria dodda-jerrane, commonly known as the "Red Psychotria," is a species of flowering plant native to the rainforests of Madagascar. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, glossy leaves and clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the undergrowth of tropical forests. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists alike.
